My research interests are statistics and phylogenetics.
My most recent [paper](https://doi.org/10.1080/01621459.2025.2485359) is on consistency of Bayesian phylogenetic inference.
[Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.co.uk/citations?user=bZ3L-mkAAAAJ&sortby=pubdate) lists my publications.
[GitHub](https://github.com/lukejkelly) hosts code for my research projects.
I was one of the developers of [TraitLab](https://sites.google.com/site/traitlab/).
See [here](https://www.ucc.ie/en/matsci/people/lukekelly/) for my contact details.

I have been a lecturer above the bar at UCC since 2022.
I was at Universit√© Paris Dauphine-PSL as a postdoc in the CEREMADE (2020--2022).
I was at the University of Oxford as a senior postdoc in the Big Data Institute (2019--2020), a stipendiary lecturer at St Peter's College (2019--2020) and a postdoc in the Department of Statistics (2016--2019).

I completed my DPhil in Statistics at the University of Oxford in 2016 under the supervision of Geoff Nicholls.
I received an MASt in Mathematics from the University of Cambridge in 2012.
I obtained a Bachelor of Actuarial & Financial Studies from University College Dublin in 2011.
